intro: Cliffortia dentata var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender mountain daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in mountainous or coastal regions. Its leaves are narrow and toothed, and the flowers are usually pale yellow or white. It is well adapted to harsh environments and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
